title: Workshop on Ontology Alignment Techniques for Quality Management in Higher Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basics of higher education quality management systems and understanding of ontology concepts
context.additional_context: Participants are professionals (medical/legal/technical) utilizing mobile-based learning tools in limited-technology environments (smartphone-centric). The curriculum centers on projects analyzing real institutional cases aligned with quality management standards

learning_goals: Ontology alignment techniques enable analysis of inter-institutional quality management standard discrepancies and design integrated strategies
Project-based assessments allow development of compatibility metrics with external institutions' quality management systems
Ontology alignment processes can be simulated using smartphone-based collaboration tools in resource-constrained technical environments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
